system.description:
Sorcerers that are loyal to a single lord, clad in shells, gold, pearls, glass beads, and intricate silks of crimson, azure, and viridian. Their power is such that they can overcome the occult strength of even a datu. They send gouts of flame and change the flow of rivers with power gained from unknowable dark powers. Dark powers that they harness and master.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Sickle Wind. Attack all enemies in an area (Path 6) with Faith.

Gambits [[/r d10]]

1-3: Rush > Inflict Violence > Rush

4-6: Rush > Inflict Violence > Mata-mata [1]: Teleport 2 and then dazzle all adjacent enemies.

7-9: Rush > Weight of the Goddess [2]: Attack all enemies in an area (range 3 burst 2) with Faith, and then slow all hit.

10: Rush > Moondance [2]: Attack all enemies in an area (line 5) with Faith, teleport 2, and then attack all enemies in an area (path 5) with Bravery.

traits.name: Conviction
traits.description: All Folk have a reason for fighting, and if reasoned to, can cause them to rethink combat. However, they will fight for their Conviction until it looks like all is bleak.

traits.name: Morale
traits.description: At the beginning of any Resound where there are twice as many Kadungganan than there are enemies (eg., If there are 4 Kadungganan and 2 Enemies left) all Folk enemies will Surrender, becoming Defeated.

traits.name: Divine Striving
traits.description: Whenever a fighter falls to 0 HP, all Akayu fighters gain Striving until the end of their next riff. Their attacks gain Overwhelming and they have +1 to all Prowesses. When they lose Striving, they heal 2.

traits.name: Pandita
traits.description: When this fighter gains Striving, inflict 1 Hit on all enemies in burst 3, and then heal 1 all allies in the burst.
